content.question: A. Other than preventing the solution from splashing out, explain why it is important to keep the lid on the calorimeter during the experiment.

frqParts.text: A. Other than preventing the solution from splashing out, explain why it is important to keep the lid on the calorimeter during the experiment.

B. Based on the data in the table, what is the sign of the enthalpy of solution, <math alttext="delta H naught sub solution" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msubsup><mi>H</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow><mo>∘</mo></msubsup></math>? Justify your answer.

C. Using the data from the experiment, calculate the magnitude of thermal energy, <math alttext="q" overflow="scroll"><mi>q</mi></math>, in joules, transferred in the dissolution of <math alttext="C a B r 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CaBr</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Assume that the mixture in the calorimeter has a specific heat capacity of <math alttext="3.61 joules per gram degree Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.61</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext><mo>/</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>g</mtext><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.

D. Using the data from the experiment, calculate the magnitude of <math alttext="delta H naught sub solution" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msubsup><mi>H</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow><mo>∘</mo></msubsup></math> of <math alttext="C a B r 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CaBr</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> in <math alttext="kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mpadded></math>.

skill.text: 2.C: Identify experimental procedures that are aligned to a scientific question (which may include a sketch of a lab setup).
